intro: Malcolmia veluchensis, commonly known as the velvet flax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare species.
